text:
The SVG below renders differently than
 (a) what I expected
 (b) Adobe SVG viewer 3.0
Specifically, the 3 lines in the SVG below display with a different x-coord
relative to each other depending on which viewer is used.
In BOTH cases, the positions are not as I expected (I suspect because the user
coords arent translated into pixels correctly relative to translating inches to
pixels).

DETAILS: I expected the second and third lines to start at the same X coord, but
with Batik the 3rd line starts with a bigger x-coord and with Adobe a smaller
x-coord than the 2nd line.

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20010904//EN"
"http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
viewBox="0 0 850 1100" height="11in" width="8.5in">

<line stroke-width="10" stroke="yellow" y2="20" x2="1in" y1="20" x1="0"
id="inchWorm"/>
<line stroke-width="10" stroke="orange" y2="30" x2="2in" y1="30" x1="1in"/>
<use xlink:href="#inchWorm" transform="translate(100 20)"/>
</svg>
creator: apache@polyglotinc.com

text:
Except for width/height on outermost SVG inches are always converted to
user space units by multiplying by 72.  I'm guessing the Adobe/Batik
discrepency is due to differnt default mappings from inches->pixels on
outermost SVG.
creator: deweese@apache.org
